summary: This document is an email chain between Bureau of Prisons personnel regarding administrative paperwork for an asbestos removal project (2D3S Remove Asbestos). It includes requests for signed project requests, certifications of funds, and approvals, dated between July and August 2019.

persons.name: Engineering Technician MCC New York Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Recipient of email requesting forwarding of signed project request for asbestos removal project.

persons.name: Mr. Bailey
persons.context: Email sender from mrbailey@bop.gov discussing the need for a signed project request and certification of funds for asbestos removal.

connections.person2: Engineering Technician MCC New York Federal Bureau of Prisons
connections.description: Colleagues within the Bureau of Prisons communicating about administrative tasks for an asbestos removal project.

events.title: Initial Asbestos Removal Request
events.description: Email sent regarding the 2D3S Remove Asbestos project, initiating the administrative process.

events.title: Request for Signed Copy
events.description: Follow-up email requesting a copy of the Warden-signed project request for the asbestos removal.

events.title: Request for Project Documentation
events.description: Email chain continues with a request to forward the signed project request and mentions having a certification of funds but missing approvals.
personsInvolved: Engineering Technician MCC New York Federal Bureau of Prisons

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: The document is an email chain about administrative procedures for an asbestos removal project (2D3S Remove Asbestos) at a Bureau of Prisons facility.
Correspondence dates from July 23, 2019, to August 12, 2019, involving Bureau of Prisons staff.
It references a certification of funds but notes missing approvals, signed requests, or other required documentation (SG or IGE).
The communication is routine administrative in nature, with no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or related individuals.
The document is part of a larger dataset (EFTA00142451, EFTA00142452) but contains no evident connection to the Epstein case beyond its file numbering.
